title: Customizing Control Buttons
content:
## What You Can Customize

Choose which control buttons appear in the main window.

## Recommended Defaults (Pre-Selected)

✓ **Power On/Off** - Essential
✓ **Input Source** - Very common
✓ **Blank Screen** - Useful for presentations
✓ **Freeze Display** - Helpful for explaining content

## Optional Controls

☐ **Volume Control** - Slider for audio level
☐ **Mute Audio** - Quick mute toggle
☐ **Picture Mode** - Switch presentation modes
☐ **Aspect Ratio** - Change screen ratio

## How to Choose

**Keep it simple!** Only enable buttons you'll use regularly.

**Basic User:**
- Power On/Off + Input Source = minimal interface

**Presenter:**
- Add Blank Screen + Freeze Display for presentation control

**Advanced User:**
- Enable all controls for complete access

## Changing Later

You can always adjust button visibility:
- **Settings** (Ctrl+,) > **UI Buttons** tab
- Check/uncheck desired buttons
- Click **Apply**

## System Tray Access

> **Note:** Even if you hide buttons from the main window, all controls remain accessible via system tray right-click menu.

> **Tip:** Start with recommended defaults. You can enable more buttons later if needed!
